entry.title: Re: API to post customer invoice with automatic tax calcu...
entry.content:
Good day @khanhlynx99 

Yes, you are right that the API you mentioned supports creating FI documents like DR, DG but this does not support automatic tax determination or calculation. You must explicitly provide the tax amount.

You can work around this by calculating tax externally when you use the Advanced TAX API simulation service, then pass tax amounts in your payload. A possible process could be:

  • You call Tax Simulation API which you can find through backend integration,
  • then parse the response and extract tax details.
  • Then construct full journal entry payload with correct tax line items.

Note that you cannot expect tax determination within the API_JOURNALENTRY_SRV. You have to handle it outside.

Alternatively, you may consider raising a feature request with SAP Customer Influence to expose tax simulations as part of the journal entry API.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP クリーンコア拡張性ガイドと日本のユーザーに向けた実践のためのお薦め
entry.content:
1. クリーンコアとは何か・SAPが提唱するクリーンコアの概要を理解する。

クリーンコアとは？

クリーンコアとは、SAPの業務システムを「標準機能を最大限活用し、必要な部分だけを安全に拡張することで、システムの複雑化や技術的負債を防ぎ、将来のアップグレードやイノベーションを容易にする」という考え方です。

もう少しだけ補足すると、 “企業のERP（基幹業務システム）を「標準化」「拡張性」「データ品質」「統合」「運用効率」の5つの原則で最適化し、継続的なビジネス変革とイノベーションを支えるための指針”です。過度なカスタマイズやサイロ化したデータ、非効率な運用を排除し、標準機能を最大限活用しつつ、必要な差別化は拡張機能やAPIで柔軟に実現します。

クリーンコアというと、今日のメインテーマである「拡張性」の部分だけが注目されがちですが、その他にも重要な検討・実行要素があることをまずは理解してほしいと思います。

クリーンコアはなぜ必要？

その必要性については、すでに何度も様々な場面でお伝えしていますが、従来型のオンプレミスERPは、標準化の欠如、過剰なカスタマイズ、データ品質の低下などがイノベーション（デジタル変革の加速、競争力維持、リアルタイムな意思決定、俊敏性・柔軟性の確保が現代企業の課題）の障害となっています。クラウドERP（SAP S/4HANA Cloud）をクリーンコア戦略で導入することで、運用コスト削減、迅速なアップグレード、AIや最新技術の活用が可能となり、ビジネス価値を最大化できます。

クリーンコアの５原則

 

#　

クリーンコアの5原則　　　　　　　　　　　　

内容　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　 　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　

1

Business Process
(ビジネスプロセス)

o     標準プロセスを最大限活用し、差別化が必要な部分のみ拡張。　　　　　　　　　　　　　

o    カスタマイズは最小限に抑え、TCO（総所有コスト）削減とビジネスアジリティ向上を実現。　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　

2

Extensibility (拡張性)

o     標準機能から外れる拡張は、SAPが提供するAPIやBTP（Business Technology Platform）を活用し、コアシステムから分離。

o    拡張のガバナンスを徹底し、技術的負債を管理・最小化。

3

Data (データ)

o    データ品質・ガバナンス・保護・効率性を重視。

o    クリーンなデータ基盤を構築し、AIや分析の精度向上、運用コスト削減、法令遵守を実現。

4

Integration (統合)

o    標準化されたAPIやイベント駆動型アーキテクチャで、システム間の連携をシンプルかつ堅牢に。

o    継続的なモダナイゼーションとガバナンス体制の確立。

5

Operations（運用）

o    ガバナンス、Toolchain、継続的改善、セキュアな運用、アジャイルなデリバリーを推進。

o    ITとビジネスの連携を強化し、変化に強い運用体制を構築。

 

どうやってクリーンコア度合いを測る？

  • クリーンコアの成熟度やガバナンス状況を評価し、KPIで進捗を可視化。
  • RISE with SAP Methodologyダッシュボードで、拡張状況やデータ品質、統合状況などを一元管理し、継続的な改善を支援。

 

どうやって進める？

  • 標準プロセスの採用とプロセス階層の整理。
  • 拡張要件のガバナンスと技術的負債の管理。
  • データガバナンス組織の設置、データ品質評価・改善サイクルの導入。
  • 統合アーキテクチャの設計とモダナイゼーション、CoE（Center of Excellence）の設置。
  • 運用面では、ツールチェーンの統合、アジャイル開発、セキュリティ基準の遵守、リリース管理の徹底。

クリーンコア戦略を採用することで、標準化と拡張性のバランスを保ちつつ、イノベーションの迅速な導入、運用効率化、AI・分析活用、セキュリティ強化を実現し、継続的なガバナンスとKPI管理により、変化に強い企業基盤を構築できます。

では、どこから手をつければいいのでしょうか？指針だけだとこれを現場で実践するには、具体的に何をすればいいのか悩んでしまうところがあるかもしれません。そこを補完し、実践すべきアクションやその実行方法やツールについて説明しているのが、「クラウドERP活用のための基本五箇条」です。これはクリーンコアに取り組むには、「何から始め、どう進めるか」を解説している日本市場向けの（SAPジャパンの紹介している）実践フレームワークです（※この基本五箇条の概要については後段で解説します）。

では、ここから本日の主題である「拡張性：Extensibility」＝”SAP クリーンコア拡張性ガイドと日本のユーザーに向けた実践のためのお薦め”の内容に入っていきたいと思います。

これを取り上げる理由は、過去に個別最適化を進めた結果としてERPのアップグレード作業・プロジェクトの負担を大きなものにしてきた大きな一因が、アドオンだからです。多くのお客様の悩みのスタートポイントがここであり、この問題へのアプローチの今を理解し、クリーンコアへ取り組むことが最適であると考えたからです。

 

2. クリーンコア：従来の3層型の拡張モデルとは

SAP S/4HANAの拡張性に関する従来のガイドラインは、以下の3つの層（Tier）で整理されていました。

  • Tier 1（公開API/拡張ポイントのみ）
    SAP    が公式に公開・保証するAPIや拡張ポイントのみを使った拡張（最も推奨される）
  • Tier 2（ラッピング/間接利用）
    直接は非推奨なオブジェクトやAPIをラッピングして間接的に利用
  • Tier 3（クラシック拡張/直接参照）
    SAP    内部オブジェクトや非公開API、モディフィケーション等、将来の互換性リスクが高い拡張

特徴：

  • 「Tier 1」以外は原則非推奨で、Tier 2/3は“やむを得ない場合のみ”という扱い。
  • 実際の現場ではTier 2/3の利用が多く、現実とのギャップが課題でした。

 

3. クリーンコア：new  Clean Core Extensibility Guide（レベル型）の特徴

3-1. 「レベル型」への進化（A～D）

レベル　　

内容　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　

代表的な技術・特徴　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　

A

公開API・拡張ポイントのみ利用　（最も推奨）

SAP Build（ABAP Cloud, CAP, Low/No Code）、SAP BTP、公開API

B

クラシックAPIやフレームワー（安定性は高いが契約保証なし）

BAPI、クラシックABAP、ALVなど

C

SAP内部オブジェクト（将来リスクあり）

非公開関数、内部テーブル等

D

推奨されない拡張（noAPI、直接書き込み、暗黙的拡張など）

noAPI、直接書き込み、暗黙的拡張

3-2. 現場適用性の向上

  • B/CレベルとしてクラシックABAPやラッピングも現実的な選択肢に昇格
  • レベルごとにリスク・推奨度・対応策を明確化
  • KPIやガバナンス、ツール（ABAP Test Cockpit等）を活用し、継続的なクリーンコア化を支援

 

4. 三層型と レベル型 (New) の比較・進化ポイント

比較表 

観点　　　　　　　　

従来の三層型　　　 　　　　　     　　

 New Clean Core Extensibility Guide （レベル型）　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　

分類

3段階（Tier 1/2/3）

4段階（A/B/C/D）でより細分化

Tier 2の扱い

ラッピングは“やむを得ない場合のみ”

Bレベルとして現実的な選択肢に昇格

クラシックABAP

原則非推奨

B/Cレベルとしてリスクを明示しつつ現実的に許容

リスク管理

“非推奨”の一括り

レベルごとにリスク・推奨度・対応策を明確化

KPI/ガバナンス

明確な指標なし

KPIやガバナンス、継続的改善サイクルを明示

現場適用性

理想論に寄りがち

レガシーや現場の実態も考慮した現実的な枠組み

進化のポイント：

  • 多くの現場でクラシックABAPやラッピングが現実的に使われている
  • 一律に“非推奨”とするのではなく、リスクを可視化し、段階的な改善を促す
  • KPIやガバナンス、ツールを活用し、継続的なクリーンコア化を支援

 

5. クラウドERP活用のための基本五箇条との関係

SAPジャパンが日本のユーザー・パートナー向けに、クラウドERP（SAP S/4HANA Cloud等）の価値を最大化し、プロジェクトを成功に導くために継続的に取り組むべき5つの検討テーマを明文化したものです。（※この章の以下の内容は、DXEYEセッションにて実施しているクラウドERP活用のための基本五箇条セッションの内容を元にしています）

基本五箇条の全体像

 

それぞれの条項について

1. Clean Coreコンセプトに則った拡張開発

検討ポイント１：既存アドオン資産（カスタムコード）の分析・評価

  • SAP S/4HANAへの移行にあたり、必ずしも全てのカスタムコードを修正する必要はありません。
  • 最低限、クリティカルな影響を受けるカスタムコードのみ修正を施すことで移行のコストを下げることができます。
  • 評価には、ABAP Test Cockpit、SAP Fiori App Custom Code Migration Tool の利用を推奨しています。
  • このツールについては、こちらのブログで詳しく説明されています。

検討ポイント２：アップグレード時の影響方法が大きい拡張方式の廃止

  • モディフィケーション、暗黙の拡張/拡張スポット、コピーアドオン、バッチインプットなどは要注意です。このような手法はアップグレード時の影響が大きいため、段階的にでもいいので廃止・極力数を減らす検討することをお勧めします。

検討ポイント３：SAP S/4HANA拡張方式の適切な選択

  • SAPが提供している拡張開発手段は、並列で見るのではなく、検討する順番があります。

  • アドオン（カスタムコード）の新規開発・再設計を検討するときには、その目的や対象ユーザ、ERP側との結合性など合理性がある判断基準を元に考える必要があります。

検討ポイント４：ABAP Cloud開発モデルの適用

  • 最も新しい４つ目の拡張開発手段であるABAP Cloud（開発者拡張やBTP側にあるABAP Cloud 環境を利用）の活用が、重要になってきます。段階的に Clean Core 化を進めるため、ABAP Test Cockpit を使用して、ABAP Cloud 開発モデルに準拠したチェック・開発を行います。このSAP認定資格を取得するエンジニアの方の数が年々増えています。
  • 詳しいガイドはこちら
  • この開発も、SAP Build AppsやBuild Process Automation, Business Application Studioなど同様にSAP BuildのLobbyから行うことができますし、Joule for Developersのリリースにより、開発者のAIサポートにより利用のハードルがどんどん低くなってきていることも良い流れです。

 

2. UX（ユーザー体験）の向上
  • 古い技術に基づく専用クライアント SAP GUI は、複雑な画面構成のため習熟には時間を要し、デバイスは限定され、個別 PC での管理が必要。
  • 各ユーザーが担当業務に必要な情報を得るために多くの個別画面でのチェックが必要になり、担当業務の状況を俯瞰することが困難。
  • 生成 AI などの最新技術を活用し、各ユーザーに最適化された画面構成で効率的に業務を行うために UX のモダナイゼーションが必要。

検討ポイント１：ビジネスロールに基づく新しい SAP 標準 UX の導入

  • デバイスにとらわれず、自身のロールに基づいて、単一エントリーポイントから SAP S/4HANA の SAP Fiori アプリケーションや情報にアクセスし業務を迅速に開始することが可能になります。
  • KPI など業務全体において一目でわかるように設計されたタイルからの“気づき”により詳細確認・アクションへとスムースに繋げる業務ナビゲーションを実現します。これにより、ユーザーは迅速に業務を行い効率を上げることができます。

検討ポイント２：顧客要件に基づく カスタム Fiori アプリの開発・導入

  • 1. でも紹介した LC/NC ツールを使用したドラッグ&ドロップでの開発に加え、プロコードツールでも AI によるコード生成、テンプレートベースでの新規画面作成やガイドつきの開発機能、スクラッチベースでの開発など様々な要件に応じてカスタムアプリを開発することができます。

検討ポイント３：社外アクセス、セントラルアクセスポイント/アプリケーションポータルの導入

  • SAP S/4HANA だけではなく、複数の SAP クラウドアプリケーション、SAP BTP 上に開発したカスタムアプリケーション、その他のアプリケーションなど業務に必要な情報に単一のポイントからアクセスすることができます。　
  • これらはいずれも SAP BTP 上のサービスであり、社内外からのアクセスが可能でマルチデバイスに対応し、場所にとらわれず柔軟に業務を行うことが可能にします。

検討ポイント４：デジタルワークプレイスの構築、社外ユーザーへの情報共有

  • SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition の機能に加えて、ドキュメントの管理や検索機能などやチーム運営、コラボレーションにおいて必要な機能を提供しデジタルワークプレイスを構築できます。
  • LC/NC でのビジネスサイトの構築が可能で、豊富な事前定義済みのコンテンツで迅速にポータルを開発することがきます。
  • 社内向けポータルだけではなく、サプライヤー向けなどの社外ポータルとしても活用が可能です。

これらの実現には、BTPだけではなく、SAP AI ナビゲータであるJouleや、Digital Assistant Platform WalkMeなどが関係してきます。

 

3. ビジネスプロセスの最適化
  • 情報を個票として管理することなく、リポジトリとして管理を一元化することで、関係者全員が End-to-End で共通認識を持つことを可能に。
  • ビジネスプロセスを“作る”ものではなく、継続的な改善サイクルの中で“使う”ものとすることで、情報の鮮度を維持、付加価値を向上。

検討ポイント1：SAP Best Practice を起点とした Fit to Standard

  • SAP Signavio Process Navigator や、SAP Signavio Process Explorer 上の SAP Best Practices を参照し、Clean Core の実現に向けた Fit to Standard ワークショップを実施します。
  • 要件定義や基本設計フェーズにおける議論の精度を向上、成果物作成を効率化するだけでなく、設計/開発/テストおよび運用を含めた後続フェーズにおける高度活用を可能とします。

検討ポイント2：ビジネスプロセスの自動化および ERP と他システム間のプロセス連携

  • ビジネストランスフォーメーションを進めるうえでビジネスプロセスの自動化は外せないテーマです。ユーザ企業は単一の ERP システムだけですべての業務が遂行できるわけではなく、他のシステムとの連携が必要です。
  • SAP Integration Suite、SAP Build Process Automation はSAP が提供するビジネスプロセスの統合および自動化基盤で、SAP が50年以上にわたり培ってきた業界・業種のビジネスプロセスの深い専門知識に基づいて事前定義されたコンテンツを提供し、「開発」プロジェクトから「活用」プロジェクトへのシフトを支援します

検討ポイント3：ビジネスプロセスを効率的に実行するハイパーオートメーション

  • デジタルかつ継続的なビジネスプロセスの改善サイクルは、業務上のボトルネックを容易に検知するだけでなく、AI により改善アクションを提案し、RPA でアクションを実行させることが可能となります。
  • 合言葉は、
    「Signavioで発見して、SAP Buildで作って（繋げて）、SAP Integrationで繋げる」　

です。

検討ポイント4：ビジネス目的/レイヤに合わせた最適な可視化

  • ビジネス活動を可視化するビジネスアナリティクスにおいても、レイヤに応じた分析視点/粒度でビジネスを可視化することで、より正確で効率的なビジネス状況の理解/活動の評価が可能となります。
  • また、可視化は一過性/局所的な視点ではなく、継続性/全体的な視点で議論を行うことが大切です。

 

4. データ利活用の高度化

検討ポイント１：SAP S/4HANA のデータをリアルタイム分析

  • SAP S/4HANA の標準ユーザーインターフェースである SAP Fiori には、業務検討テーマに沿った分析画面や、多次元レポートが組み込まれており、業務オペレーションとレポーティング/分析を分けずに、１つの画面から業務に必要とされる操作を行うことが可能です。
  • 各業務で見るべきデータから、データを見た後の後続処理をそのまま実行できるように画面がデザインされており、SAP S/4HANA の利用ユーザは誰でも、この革新的なインターフェースを利用することができます。

検討ポイント２：SAP S/4HANA と連携した統合財務計画

  • SAP S/4HANA と SAP Analytics Cloud を組み合わせて利用することで、SAP S/4HANA とシームレスに連携できる統合予算管理機能を提供します。
  • 同一マスタを利用した予算編成、リアルタイムな進捗確認、シミュレーションによる着地予測など、予算管理業務を包括的にサポートし、経営計画・業務計画と整合性が取れた、より高度な経営管理モデルの実現に寄与します。

検討ポイント３：意思決定を支援するデータ利活用基盤の構築

  • SAP S/4HANA が持つ基幹業務データと、社内外にある多種多様なデータを一貫した基準で統合し、より価値あるデータ利活用の実現をサポートするため、 SAP Datasphere を利用できます。
  • データ利活用ためのビジネスコンテキスト（データの関連性、意味合いなど）を損なうことなく、データ連携・統合ができるため、正確な業務データを迅速にユーザに提供でき、意思決定のスピードと精度の向上に寄与します。

検討ポイント４：データ利活用を促進するデータガバナンスの実現

  • 企業が持つ価値あるデータを効率的に管理し、データの検索、共有、理解を支援するための、レポートカタログおよびデータカタログ機能を提供します。
  • データの正確な情報源を証明し、企業におけるデータの意味、定義、利用用途を一元管理することが可能です。
  • 信頼のおけるデータをユーザに提供できることで、データを活用したコミュニケーションを促進し、データ活用文化の醸成に貢献します。

 

5. アプリケーションライフサイクル管理の効率化
  • 継続的なデジタル変革を実現するためには、ビジネス要件に対するアプリケーションの実装と運用のサイクルを迅速に繰り返し回していく必要があります。
  • しかし、標準化されておらずクラウドに最適化されていない導入プロジェクト管理では、ビジネス要件を実現する開発オブジェクト間の不整合や大きなテスト工数等により、実装期間の長期化、遅延が発生しがちです。
  • また、個別の運用管理が工数とコストを消費し、戦略的 IT 業務へのリソースシフトを妨げている場合もあります。

検討ポイント1：SAP 標準導入方法論に準拠した導入プロジェクト管理　SAP Activate 導入方法論とプロジェクト管理基盤 SAP Cloud ALM

  • SAP Activateは、Fit to StandardアプローチとBest Practiceを活用し、アジャイル手法を取り入れたSAP標準の導入方法論です。これにより、クラウドソリューションの迅速な導入と継続的なイノベーションを支援します。
  • SAP Cloud ALMは、SAP Activateのタスクテンプレートやガイドを活用し、導入プロジェクトを一貫して管理します。Fit to Standardワークショップから設定・変更のデプロイ、テスト準備や自動化ツールとの連携まで、効率的なアプリケーションライフサイクル管理を実現します。

検討ポイント2：一貫した CI/CD, 変更・移送管理基盤の構築　SAP BTP CI/CDサービス、SAP Cloud ALM

  • SAP BTP CI/CDサービスでコード変更を自動で構築・テスト・デプロイし、開発からリリースまでのサイクルを短縮します。
  • SAP Cloud ALMで、SAP BTPとSAP S/4HANAの移送管理と連携し、拡張アプリとIn-App拡張を一元管理を行い、変更・承認プロセスの一貫性を確保し、移送の集中管理を実現します。

検討ポイント3：影響分析とテストの自動化　SAP Application Testing Solutions by Tricentis

  • システムの新規設定および変更による影響が大きいオブジェクト＝リスクの高いオブジェクトの特定から、変更に対するテストの自動化を通して、業務プロセスおよび機能の実装スピードを向上し、継続的なビジネス変化への対応を支援します。

検討ポイント４：運用コスト削減を実現するソリューション　SAP Cloud ALM 運用管理

  • SAP Cloud ALM は SAP S/4HANA Cloud をはじめ各種クラウドアプリケーションと SAP BTP を含むクラウドソリューションの導入と運用を支援する、アプリケーションライフサイクル管理の統合ソリューションです。
  • SAP Cloud ALM の運用向けの機能では、ビジネスプロセス実行の KPI 監視、システム間統合の監視、ユーザー視点での性能の可視化、ジョブ監視、ヘルス監視等を提供し、マルチクラウド環境下での安定稼働と運用コストの低減を実現します。

さらに、RISE with SAP Methodology （SAP Activateに基づいたClean Core実践のための導入方法論）や SAP Tool Chain （企業のクラウドERP移行やデジタルトランスフォーメーションを支援するために設計されたSAPおよびパートナー製ツール群の統合エコシステムです。単なる個別ツールの集合ではなく、戦略策定から運用までを一貫してサポートする仕組み）などの利用を検討することで検討と実現を加速することが可能になります。

関係性：

  • Clean Core Extensibility Guideが示す原則・レベル分けを、五箇条のTipやツール・サービスを活用して現場で実践することが、プロジェクト成功の近道です。
  • 五箇条は、現場での実践やプロジェクト推進に役立つ具体的な検討テーマ・Tipを整理したガイドラインであり、クリーンコア戦略の現場適用を強力にサポートします。

 

６. 実践のためのガイドラインとおすすめリソース

  • SAP Application Extension Methodology：拡張アーキテクチャ設計のためのフレームワーク
  • SAP Cloud ALM：要件管理・トレーサビリティ・ガバナンス強化
  • ABAP Test Cockpit：自動コードチェックとクリーンコアレベル判定
  • SAP Build：AI活用のローコード／プロコード開発環境
  • SAPジャパンの支援サービス：現状分析・方針策定・設計・運用・DX推進まで、各フェーズに応じた多様なサービスを提供

参考リンク：

  • https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-cloud/why-abap-cloud
  • https://www.sap.com/products/erp/rise/methodology/clean-core.html
  • https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-btp-guidance-framework/sap-application-extension-methodology/sap-application-extension-methodology-overview
  • https://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/build.html
  • https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/btp-developers-guide/what-is-btp-developers-guide?version=Cloud

 

7. まとめ

  • クリーンコア戦略（Clean Core Extensibility Guide）は「原則・全体像」
  • 旧3層型ガイドラインと比べて、より現実的・実践的な枠組みへ進化
  • 基本五箇条は「現場での実践Tip・検討テーマ」
  • 両者を組み合わせて活用することで、SAP ERPプロジェクトの成功と継続的なイノベーションを実現できます

entry.title: Data not visible of BIN and storage type wise stock - S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Dear SAP support Team,

We require a consolidated report covering the following fields: Material, Plant, Storage Location, Warehouse Number, Batch, BIN, Stock Type and Stock.

Kindly suggest the standard SAP application or CDS view or query for reporting this data.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Data not visible of BIN and storage type wise stock -...
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud provides several applications for stock visibility, but none delivers all required fields—material, plant, storage location, stock type, warehouse number, and bin details—in a single consolidated report. The Stock – Multiple Materials app covers basic inventory information, while Display Storage Bin and the Warehouse Monitor provide warehouse and bin-level visibility. These need to be used together, as the stock app does not include warehouse details.

Available CDS views (such as I_SerialNumberStockSegment, I_ML_BALANCE, and I_ProductStorageLocation) also cover only part of the dataset and cannot generate a unified report through standard functionality.

To achieve full visibility, the recommended approach is to combine the existing SAP applications:

  • Use Stock – Multiple Materials for core stock data.
  • Use Display Storage Bin or the Warehouse Monitor APPs for warehouse/bin information.
  • Correlate the data manually when both views are needed together.

If a unified report is required, a custom CDS view or an enhancement request via Customer Influence may be considered, since no standard solution currently provides all fields in one output.

For implementation, ensure the correct business roles are assigned (e.g., SAP_BR_INVENTORY_MANAGER, SAP_BR_WAREHOUSE_CLERK) and retrieve warehouse details through the bin display applications.

Resources

  • Stock – Multiple Materials (SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library)
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/aff0b3f5f46c42a2b2c0fabfc233bab2/f27e02758591469fa489705a1d212df4.html

  • App Extensibility: Stock – Multiple Materials
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/d451f280bc3646bb9c3cb0ac37acc34e.html

  • Display Storage Bins (Fiori App Reference) — https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/?appId=%2FSCWM%2FLS03 fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com

  • Warehouse Monitor (Fiori App Reference) — https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/

  • Creating Custom CDS Views (Custom CDS Views app)
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/b0000072fe994d7b9d5e015adf066059.html

  • Virtual Data Model and CDS Views in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/c0c54048d35849128be8e872df5bea6d/8573b810511948c8a99c0672abc159aa.html

  • Inventory Analysis Overview
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/2deffbe9d21f4b5fb1f998e9834019d1.html

  •  ##2963059 - How to Submit Feature Requests for SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Product.

Best Regards,

SAP Support.

entry.title: Re: Warehouse Management
entry.content: In SAP S/4HANA 2023, you should use transaction LX23 (Stock Inconsistency Correction) or perform a WM-only physical inventory (LX22/LX17) to align WM stock with IM stock. This way, IM stock remains unchanged, and WM stock is corrected to match IM.  Check SAP notes 535043 & 1871525

entry.title: OPA5 vs wdi5 vs Playwright-SAP: pros and cons?
entry.content:
Hi everyone, 

I'm setting up automated testing for some SAP UI5 applications, and I'm hesitating between three different test runners since, as far as I can tell, they all have pros and cons. The issue being: I'm not sure I gathered the correct informations - especially for Playwright SAP, which is scarcely mentionned in the SAP documentation or during community discussions.

Here is what I have gathered so far:

OPA5

Pros

- Official SAP standard, audit- and certification-friendly

- UI5 control-level testing, very high stability

- Very reliable in CI with QUnit and ui5-test-runner

Cons

- Slow to write and slow to execute

- Verbose, low developer productivity

- Poor fit for fast iteration and large test suites

 

wdi5

Pros

- UI5 control-level access with real browser execution

- Much faster and more flexible than OPA5

- Industrial-grade quality when well maintained

Cons

- Complex setup and maintenance (WebDriver, browser, CI)

- Higher operational cost for small teams

- Not an official SAP standard

 

Playwright-SAP

Pros

- Very fast to write and to execute

- Simple CI integration with modern tooling

- Free and pragmatic for hybrid SAP environments

Cons

- Not officially recognized by SAP

- Still partly DOM-dependent

- Weaker long-term robustness and certification value

 

Am I missing something here? I'm part of a small team that aims at SAP certification and quality standard, so I'm trying to make an informed decision.

Thanks in advance for your guidance, 

Cheers, 

Theo

entry.title: Tablechecker and Timeanalyzer for SWPM Export and Import
entry.content:
Running Table checker after SWPM Export and Import:

The Table Checker is used to verify if the number of rows been exported is the same as the number of rows in the database (not usable in Socket mode). This tool can be used to verify that any table’s row count during export matches with that table’s row count after import. The comparison is done with the information of the <PACKAGE>.TOC files against the record count in the database. The table checker is run after the import using a connection to the target database. In detail, the tool uses the table of content (TOC) files that hold information on the number of rows exported for each individual table and about the physical location of the table content inside the dump file. A known limitation is, that tables, which were declustered cannot be checked by table checker. If a difference is found, these table are logged in the invalid_tables.txt file. Only tables with errors will be logged. Tablechecker can be executed before starting the SAP Application after export and import.

Pre-requisites:

  • JRE version 1.4.1 or higher
  • JAVA_HOME environment variable must point to the JRE directory.
  • The database must be running to establish a JDBC connection.
  • For non-Oracle databases, the JDBC driver class name / JDBC URL should be known.
  • The JDBC_JAR environment variable must point to the jar file with the JDBC driver. E.g. : <ORACLE_HOME>/jdbc/lib/classes12.jar for Oracle.

The tablechecker script is located in the MIGCHECK.SAR archive. After extracting the SWPM SAR file, MIGCHECK.SAR file is available under /SWPM/COMMON/INSTALL/ directory.

Below steps were followed during import to execute tablechecker script for Oracle to HANA migration using SWPM R3load export and import method. The import was performed on RISE.

  1. Access CI application server where SWPM is launched
  2. Switch to <sidadm> user
  3. Run commands : setenv JAVA_HOME /usr/lib64/jvm/java-1.8.0-ibm-1.8.0/jre/ and setenv JDBC_JAR  /sapmnt/<SID>/exe/uc/linuxx86_64/hdbclient/ngdbc.jar
  4. Extract MIGCHECK.SAR archive to separate directory
  5. Switch to directory where MIGCHECK.SAR was extracted to
  6. Run table_checker.sh script as below

./table_checker.sh -unicode -tocDirs <export directory/ABAP/DATA> -user <schemauser> -password ******* -driver com.sap.db.jdbc.Driver -url jdbc:sap://<dbhostname>:3<hanadbinstancenumber>41 –trace all

 

Output of the command should list all tables that have different export and import row counts.

Running import and export time analyzer scripts:

The Time Analyzer tool is used to analyze unload/load times for packages and individual tables.

Pre-requisites:

  • JRE version 1.4.1 or higher
  • JAVA_HOME environment variable must point to the JRE directory.

The tool is located in the MIGTIME.SAR archive. After extracting the SWPM SAR file, MIGTIME.SAR archive is available under /SWPM/COMMON/INSTALL/ directory.

Below steps were followed during import to execute import_time.sh script for Oracle to HANA migration using SWPM R3load export and import method. The import was performed on RISE.

  1. Access CI application server where SWPM is launched
  2. Switch to <sidadm> user
  3.  Run commands : setenv JAVA_HOME /usr/lib64/jvm/java-1.8.0-ibm-1.8.0/jre/ and setenv JDBC_JAR  /sapmnt/<SID>/exe/uc/linuxx86_64/hdbclient/ngdbc.jar
  4. Extract MIGTIME.SAR archive to separate directory
  5. Switch to directory where MIGTIME.SAR was extracted to
  6. Run import_time.sh script as below

./import_time.sh -installDir <sapinst log directory> -dataDirs <path to export directory/ABAP/DATA -h 1 -txt -h -xml -html

The output of command can be seen in import_time.html file

Similar steps can be executed to get export time of packages  using export_time.sh script

entry.title: Re: billing tax code determination incorrect after saving
entry.content:
Let's try other approach:

S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Tax Code Redetermination Issue

I understand you're experiencing a specific issue in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition where the tax code is correct during billing document creation but changes incorrectly after saving, despite having no custom logic in the system.

Root Cause Analysis

This is a known system behavior documented in SAP Knowledge Base Article 3596118 [1]. The issue occurs when the SD_BIL_DATA_TRANSFER BAdI clears the pricing type during the billing document save process, even when no custom BAPI logic exists.

Technical Explanation

The Problem Pattern:

  • Tax condition is not automatically redetermined when creating a billing document
  • Pricing type in copying control is correctly set as "G: Redetermine taxes, internal prices; condition category L"
  • The issue specifically occurs during the save operation [1]

System Behavior: In S/4HANA Cloud, some calculations can only be made when the pricing result is known for all items of the document, such as determination of rounding differences or scales for group conditions [2]. This standard behavior can cause tax amounts to differ after invoice creation.

Standard System Limitation

Critical Point: The pricing type "G" is hard-coded in certain scenarios in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition [3][4]:

  • When using "Create Billing Documents" app with "Display billing documents after creation" setting enabled
  • When creating billing documents from preliminary billing documents
  • During the data transfer process in billing document creation

Available Solutions

Option 1: BAdI Implementation Review

Even though you mentioned no custom logic exists, verify if the SD_BIL_DATA_TRANSFER BAdI is implemented in your system. The BAdI documentation states that "all changeable attributes are initial when the BAdI is called" and requires proper copying of values from BIL_DOC, BIL_DOC_ITEM, and BIL_DOC_ITEM_CONTR to corresponding changing attributes [5].

Option 2: Alternative Billing Creation Methods

Workaround Options:

  • Use "Create Billing Documents - VF01" app instead of the standard "Create Billing Documents" app [4]
  • Disable the "Display billing documents after creation" setting in the Create Billing Documents app
  • Consider using different copying control configurations if applicable to your scenario

Option 3: Manual Tax Adjustment

Since manual tax classification changes are not possible after saving in Public Cloud, consider:

  • Making tax adjustments in preliminary billing documents before final creation [3]
  • Ensuring master data accuracy before billing document creation

Recommended Action Path

Immediate Steps:

  1. Document the exact scenario where tax code changes occur
  2. Use Pricing Analysis in the billing document to trace determination logic
  3. Test with VF01 app as an alternative creation method
  4. Review master data consistency for customer and material tax classifications

Long-term Resolution: This appears to be a system limitation rather than a configuration issue. Consider raising a support case with SAP, referencing Knowledge Base Article 3596118, to request clarification on expected system behavior or potential fixes.

The behavior you're experiencing is documented as standard system functionality in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, where certain pricing determinations are hard-coded and cannot be modified through configuration alone.

entry.title: SAP AI SKILLS ASSESSMENT RESULTS: THE MOTIVATION IS THERE, BUT ARE WE READY TO IMPLEMENT?
entry.content:
Results of the SAP AI Self-Assessment - a quick Intro

The SAP Business AI Skills Assessment measures readiness across five AI capability areas: SAP Joule (Copilot & Agents), Embedded AI Scenarios, Machine Learning Services on SAP BTP, SAP Build Joule Studio, and Responsible AI Practices.
Each area is evaluated across four dimensions: Awareness, Motivation, Knowledge, Implementation.
68 responses were collected (September-November 2025) from SAP professionals across 12 countries, spanning consultants, architects, project managers, and IT leaders in industries from manufacturing to financial services.

Who Responded

  • Geographic: 55% Germany, 10% India, 6% USA (Germanspeaking countries = 63% total)
  • Industry: 33% Service sector, 21% Discrete Manufacturing, 23% Others (IT/consulting)
  • SAP Focus: 71% S/4HANA, so it is primarily an ERP transformation story, SAP SuccessFactors as a distant second with 14.6%
  • Scale: 45% work with 1,000+ SAP users (enterprise deployments)

The AI Skills Gap (Awareness | Motivation | Knowledge | Implementation)

SAP Joule (Copilot & Agents):
  • Awareness: 3.77 | Motivation: 4.30 | Knowledge: 2.81 | Implementation: 2.38
  • Gap between Motivation and Implementation: 1.92 points

Embedded AI in SAP Cloud Solutions:

  • Awareness: 2.91 | Motivation: 4.17 | Knowledge: 2.67 | Implementation: 2.11
  • Gap between Motivation and Implementation: 2.06 points

Machine Learning Services on SAP BTP:

  • Awareness: 2.38 | Motivation: 3.93 | Knowledge: 2.24 | Implementation: 1.69
  • Gap between Motivation and Implementation: 2.24 points (the largest gap)

SAP Build Joule Studio:

  • Awareness: 2.37 | Motivation: 3.72 | Knowledge: 1.98 | Implementation: 1.88
  • Gap: 1.84 points

Responsible AI Practices:

  • Awareness: 3.16 | Motivation: 4.12 | Knowledge: 2.51 | Implementation: 2.43
  • Gap: 1.69 points
SAP AI Skills Self-Assessment results

Geographic and Industry Patterns

Top Countries by Average AI Skills:

  • India: 2.88 | Germany: 2.76 | USA: 2.73. Smaller markets (Switzerland, Austria) show wider variance. 
Top Industries:
  • Consumer Goods: 3.00 | IT/Consulting: 2.93 | Manufacturing: 2.80 | Service: 2.70
  • The Service sector's moderate scores are particularly significant given it represents one-third of respondents—this is a mainstream market, and they're just below the "somewhat agree" midpoint on implementation capability. However if we look at the sample sizes this differences probably are not statistically significant. 

KEY FINDINGS of the SAP AI Skills-Self Assessment

1. The Implementation Challenge

2-point gaps between motivation and implementation create several risks: failed pilot projects, shadow AI implementations bypassing governance, and competitive disadvantage from delayed adoption.

2. The Awareness Trap

SAP Joule has strong awareness (3.77) - probably from the strong marketing boosts. But 38% have never heard of ML Services on BTP (2.38 awareness). We know that you can't implement what you don't know.

3. The Governance thread

Responsible AI shows the second-smallest gap (1.69 points), but the absolute scores are concerning. Implementation averaging 2.43 means most organizations are deploying AI without robust ethical frameworks, data governance, or regulatory compliance measures. With AI regulations tightening globally (EU AI Act, various data protection laws), this is a compliance time bomb.

4. The S/4HANA focus

With 70.8% of respondents focused on S/4HANA, the AI skills gaps impact the success of organizations' most critical ERP transformations. S/4HANA's embedded AI capabilities and Joule integration aren't "nice-to-have" features—they're core value propositions. Missing these capabilities means organizations are upgrading infrastructure while leaving innovation value on the table. 

CRITICAL ANALYSIS

These results suggest the SAP ecosystem is approaching a skills crisis in Business AI. Here's why:

  • Talent scarcity: Only 6-17% can implement AI solutions. 
  • The cost of delay: While teams are "motivated" (4.0+), competitors with implementation skills may already deploying and iterating. 
  • Skills Cluster Together: 8 strong correlations were found between AI capabilities. The strongest was between ML Services ↔ Joule Studio (somehow common-sense that technical skills go together). So you could build cross-capability curricula.
  • False comfort: Awareness does not equal readiness. 
  • Ungoverned experimentation: High motivation (4.12) + low governance & implementation skills (2.43) means that teams might rush to "do AI" without frameworks. 
  • Organization Size is Irrelevant: There is no correlation (ρ = -0.04, p = 0.74) between company size and capability.
  • The "Dangerous Enthusiasm" Cohort: 12.4% are highly motivated but lack fundamental knowledge. This implies the risk: of ungoverned deployments → failed pilots → AI resistance. 

I also did some deep statistical analysis (ANOVA, Regression and Correlation tests) and the key implications by Claudes 4.5 deep research is something  I could not formulate better.  

"Replace awareness metrics with deployment capability. Use Outcome based criteria like productive deployment, not exam scores. THE ONE ACTION: Stop measuring readiness by surveys. Promote and measure actual deployment capability. "

CALL TO ACTION: CLOSE THE AI SKILLS GAP

What does that implicate for individuals? I suggest a 3-Step Action Plan:

  1. Assess yourself honestly - Take the self-assessment

  2. Prioritize your own learning path by topic & role 

    • Architects/Consultants --> Joule + Embedded AI + Responsible AI
    • Developers --> ML Services on BTP + Joule Studio + the Certification
    • Project Managers --> Governance + awareness across all areas
    • IT Managers --> Strategic awareness + investment decisions

  3. Build implementation skills: Motivation + knowledge without practice = continued gap

You find the Assessment and a selection of SAP AI Learning offerings here on this landingpage (if you are german-speaking: check out this blog) .  

Call to Action for Companies

Here is a suggested AI Enablement Strategy:

  1. Baseline assessment across teams (use the same framework)
  2. Role-based learning paths (not everyone needs everything)
  3. Hands-on labs, projects and POCs (application skills come only via practice & reflection) to convert theoretical experts
  4. Give room for Peer-Learning (Communities, Learning circles, Workshops where people can learn from each other)
  5. Identify internal champions (leverage your AI ambassadors, e.g. implementation ready professionals)
  6. Address awareness first as everyone needs to understand AI basics - but build in hands-on practice for everyone
  7. Establish Responsible AI governance now (not after deployment)

Call to Action for SAP Partners

  • Enable selected resources in your SAP services Team to avoid the awareness-implementation gap and support your customers in closing their skills-gap e.g. with PoCs, pilots etc. 
  • Set up SAP Business AI Discovery workshops to find out feasible, value adding AI use cases.   
  • Build genuine implementation expertise while the market remains stuck in awareness/knowledge phases. This really can be a differentiator. 

Stop doing the following

  • Awareness-only training (creates 73.7% leakage) 
  • Measuring success by course completion (this is just input-related - no outcome)
  • Assuming large (resource rich) organizations are more ready

For a consolidated List of recomendations see also my SAPNews feature: 7 Tips for Developing SAP AI Skills.

CONCLUSION

The SAP Business AI Skills Assessment results reveal an interesting analysis. Motivation is high—higher than awareness in some cases —indicating AI's strategic importance. But the implementation skills lag dangerously behind. One explanation could be, that individuals are highly motivated, but the organizational speed of AI implementation lacks behind. Obviously using AI Tools for improving individual productivity is faster and simpler than re-engineering processes or embedding AI. 

For individuals, this gap represents career opportunity - they can build implementation skills now while the market is undersupplied.
For companies, this gap represents a risk: competitors who close the gap faster will capture AI's competitive advantages while you're still "motivated to learn more." Many of the learning offerings are even free. 
For the SAP ecosystem broadly, this gap represents an urgent enablement challenge. We can't realize the promise of SAP's Business AI investments if the professionals who must implement them lack the skills to do so.
But this is actually good news. People are highly motivated to use SAP Business AI and its components. To foster motivation is always one of the most difficult parts in digital adoption. Knowledge and skill gaps can be closed. Awareness can be built. So leverage this situation and the motivation - check out the curated SAP AI training and learning offerings. Start learning today or ask your teams to develop SAP AI capabilities. 
 
For questions and feedback please use the comments below.

entry.title: Re: Change the remitter name (payer name / 振込元の依頼人名) only...
entry.content:
Good day @Linh_NguyenThiThao 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following reference.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/9d271749cf1148058b9acd9e0d8bf02a/158e8b6aefb8430d89d28960d33818ac.html?locale=en-US

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/164aaa06151b4106b7bc163efe97902a/ed166f63a4de44afab81168bb8bab9ae.html?locale=en-US

Answer to question 1:

No. There is no supported BAdI, SSCUI or configuration in public cloud that allows you to override the remitter name at the vendor level. These restrictions are in place due to the clean-core principle.

Answer to question 2:

Yes, that is the recommended workaround. You basically create a new Payment Method through SSCUI 101044, set a custom remitter name for that method and assign the new payment method only to the specific vendor in their master data. You can achieve isolating the remitter name for that supplier.

Answer to question 3:

Yes, it is a public cloud limitation. I have had a few instances, especially Japan related use cases and the recommendation is to make use of a multiple payment method.

In summary, the reason why the public cloud does not allow you to enhance the remitter dynamically through Payment Medium Cloud BAdIs is because:

  1. Firstly, the system populates the payer field during proposal and this is based on a hard-coded logic.
  2. Secondly, public cloud BAdIs such as Payment Medium tend to add fields, while Payment Mediums allow file name change within limited file-level.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: How to call a RAP action from your Controller Extension
entry.content:
Traditionally to improve performance of a Fiori application the roundtrips to the backend (OData Service) should be minimal. To achieve this, we can push some processing logic to the frontend, This Blog explores one of the option to do that.

RAP Action

One of RAP’s powerful capabilities is the concept of actions — custom operations tied to a business object that let you implement domain-specific logic in ABAP using the behaviour implementation class (e.g. “approve order,” “mass update statuses,” “trigger workflow,” etc.) rather than relying purely on standard CRUD behaviour.

When you want to expose such actions in the UI of your RAP based Fiori App, there are two ways you can do it,

  • Using OData Annotations
  • Using Controller extensions

This blog covers a basic scenario of adding a custom button on the list page.

Using OData Annotations

Using OData annotation is the easier way out and suggested by SAP. SAP don’t want ABAPers to think much about the front end, that’s where the Fiori elements come in which is standard UI5 library to deploy Fiori apps, using which any ABAPer can create a Fiori app without have any knowledge about UI5.

Fiori elements generate the Fiori app in runtime using

  • OData Annotations
  • OData Service
  • Standard Fiori Floorplans.

So, adding your annotations in the below manner to your CDS will add the custom action on your Fiori App.

For sake of simplicity, I am using a static action

Below is the metadata extension file containing the UI annotations

Result,

 

You can write the business logic for this action in the behaviour implementation class

Using Controller extensions

If your requirement is not fulfilled by using the OData Annotations, for instance you want to call multiple actions using a single button or push some processing to your frontend rather than the backend (Your OData Service). You can use application modeler to add a custom button in the front end.

You can add a custom button using Application Modeler and add a handler method in your Controller extension. Using this handler method, you can call the same custom action from the RAP OData V4 service.

In the below example I am adding a custom button on the list page in the table toolbar.

Make Sure that you have created a Controller Extension for the page you are adding the custom button to, you can do that using the application modeler as well

Once the custom action is added you can add the below logic to call the custom action of the OData Service, you can replace the endpoint as per your OData service

     

OnActionPress: async function() {
// Calling a custom action of RAP Bobj using Controller ext
console.log("OnActionPress");
// Getting service URL
var model = this.base.getExtensionAPI().getModel();
var url = model.sServiceUrl;

// Making a GET call to fetch CSRF Token
var getTokenResp = await fetch( url, { method: "GET", headers: 
{ "X-CSRF-Token": "Fetch", Accept: "application/json" },credentials: "same-origin"  });
var token = getTokenResp.headers.get("x-csrf-token");	

// Calling Custom action by making a POST call
var uploadEndpoint = url + "Y_C_UTILAPP_PG/SAP__self.Upload";
const uploadResp = await fetch(uploadEndpoint, {
                        method: "POST",
                        headers: {
                            "Content-Type": "application/json",
                            Accept: "application/json",
                            "X-CSRF-Token": token
                        },
                        credentials: "same-origin"
                    });
console.log("Calling a custom action of RAP Bobj using Controller ext"); }

Result

A similar custom button will be created

Pressing this button will trigger the handler method ‘OnActionPress’ which will make the POST call triggering the same ‘Upload’ static action of the RAP Business Object.

 

PS: Thank you for reading. I’ll be writing more blogs soon on RAP, OData, UI5, and flexible programming languages — hope to see you there!

entry.title: SAP Mobile Start V2.5 - Release update brings UX and To-Do enhancements
entry.content:
With the recently released version 2.5, SAP Mobile Start adopts Apple's new Liquid Glass design language and provides several enhancements for To-Dos.

Let´s start with Liquid Glass. With Liquid Glass, Apple has unified its platform design language across Apple’s ecosystem of products. Liquid Glass provides a much more dynamic and expressive user experience and complements the experience of latest Apple devices like the Apple iPhone 17 – e.g. the round edges of the latest devices are now also reflected in the new design language.  

What does this mean for our iOS users of SAP Mobile Start? First, you get a more dynamic user experience, but most important is that you get more space on the screen as the navigation bar collapses if it is not needed. Also, the content scrolls below the navigation and header bar.

 Screenshot: New Liquid Glass design of SAP Mobile Start 

Another small but worth to mention UX enhancement is that empty pages are not shown on the App Screen anymore. In the past, the app showed empty pages that did not have any mobile app assigned. With the new release, those are not shown anymore. 


On the To-Dos screen, you get an additional To-Do filter option with the new release. This allows you to filter your to-dos by semantic groups defined in Task Center. For instance, you can have a group "Procurement", that automatically brings together to-dos from different source systems into one streamlined view. Furthermore, you can switch from the standard card view to a new compact view that provides you more flexibility to choose the view of your to-dos, based on the amount of to-dos you are dealing with. Please check our SAP Help documentation for details.  
Screenshot: To-Do screen with new filter and view type

I hope you will enjoy these features in SAP Mobile Start.

For further information on the new topics, please check our SAP Mobile Start documentation.

SAP Mobile Experience offers intelligent native mobile solutions that help businesses build more efficient, resilient and sustainable end-to-end processes, improving people’s work life wherever they are.

Visit SAP Mobile Experience Community Page and click “follow” to get the latest development and innovation of our solutions. We look forward to hearing about your experience with setting up the solution in your landscape; please do share your thoughts and comments below. Enter here for additional questions regarding SAP Mobile Experience Applications.

Want to be notified? Check your profile settings to ensure you have your settings activated.

entry.title: Re: Payment on Account A001 amount is not reflecting in P...
entry.content:
Product A001 has a default Account Assignment Group of X6. G/L account 41007100 by default is assigned to X6.

Project Billing only checks against G/L accounts maintained under Cost Element Group YBPS_R030 for On-Account Issued. G/L account 41007100 should be assigned to YBPS_R030.

Check in app Display Line Items in General Ledger that the Invoice was posted against 41007100. If not, then correct the above configuration.

entry.title: Re: regarding Backorder Processing (BOP)
entry.content:
Good day @S-O 

This Blog has some good insights: Backorder Processing in advanced ATP

In summary, BOP does not perform a final ATP confirmation for orders that are credit-blocked in public cloud and the reason is:

  • When you create a sales order and it exceeds your credit limit, the system blocks the order from ATP confirmation and thereby no delivery process is triggered.
  • Even if stock then becomes available at a later time, BOP will still consider the blocked Sales orders as a valid demand when the simulation runs and may then reserve inventory for them.
  • However, because the credit block is not changed, the system does not update the quantities confirmed in VA03, even if your BOP shows “Credit Warning and Saved”

Technically the system tries to differentiate the various scenarios.

Step 1: You create Sales Orders e.g., in your case 1 through to 3, without stock, the system technically does not confirm due to the lack of material/stock availability.

Step 2: In a situation where Order are Credit blocked; the system suspends the ATP check and applies the credit block.

Step 3: In a situation when inventory becomes available; the BOP still includes blocked Sos in the demand.

Step 4: Then, the BOP run process Sales Orders; the logs may show Credit Warning and the system simulates reservation.

Step 5: In this case VA03 will still show 0 confirmed quantity because the credit block is still in place.

Step 6: Thereafter the Product Availability App shows that you reserved, which means BOP has reserved inventory virtually.

Step 7: Now your new SO4 sees no stock because inventory appears consumed by earlier blocked Sales Orders.

So, while technically there is no confirmation in the system, BOP holds inventory virtually for the cred-blocked orders until you either unblock or reject them.

Based on your description, I understand your goal is to free up stock for new orders. If that assumption is correct then my suggestion is to:

  1. Either release the Credit Block in your system (Once you have released the system, it will trigger a new ATP check and the system will confirm available quantities.) or,
  2. You exclude Blocked Orders from your BOP (This will prevent BOP from reserving stock for orders that are not eligible for confirmation)

Here is a insightful answer to a similar community question: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/credit-blocks-after-atp-bop-run/qaa-p/12697502#M4135937

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Set up custom security logs
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I have a request from a customer who needs to implement monitoring on the following events to comply with their internal Security requirements :

  • User logons and logon attempts (successful and failed)
  • User account modifications (creation, modification, deletion, role changes)
  • Access to sensitive data and critical transactions
  • Unauthorized access attempts (authorization failures)
  • System configuration and security parameter changes

Their Security requirements are the following:

  1. Confirmation that the Security Audit Log is enabled on their tenant with capture of critical security events
  2. Access to the “Display Security Audit Log” Fiori application for security/audit teams
  3. Documentation on the complete list of events captured in their Cloud edition
  4. Ability to export these logs to enable automated security alerting and monitoring

I was advised that CAS (Cloud Application Services) could address these kind of needs but these are not for "one shot" request, CAS are indeed used for recurring activities ; I also raised a CISA request but the URL they've provided seems to be outdated. 

Thanks much in advance

entry.content:

entry.title: Re: 0EMPLOYEE_ATTR & PA0000(CDS View) BW4HANA
entry.content:
Hi,

Have you checked the output of your PA0000 view? It looks like you are building the key on the start date for the record and the employee number. This would mean that you could get multiple records per employee, as it would be likely that there are employees who have been transferred more than once. Including BEGDA in the key would mean that you will then possibly have multiple records per employee (explaining 199 not 153).

On the other hand, the 0EMPLOYEE_ATTR view will likely return only a single record per employee when filtered for the 31.12.9999 end date.

Be aware that future dated changes for employee records would generally be possible, so filtering on ENDDA = 31.12.9999 is not reliable. Better practice depending on your exact requirement would either be to perform the join with time dependency (so looking up PERSG and PERSK from Employee master data based on the the end date of the PA0000 record) or perhaps reporting the current values of PERSG and PERSK by filtering the PA0001 data for records where the current system date is between BEGDA and ENDDA.

Cheers, Ivan.

entry.content:
Problem:
In early November 2025, Microsoft deprecated the “SharedWithMe” functionality in the Graph API. As a result:

  • New scheduled jobs attempting to save to or read from SharedWithMe destinations cannot be established.

  • Existing schedules/publications continue to run, but once broken, they may become unmaintainable.

  • Collaboration is impacted, since users must now rely solely on OneDrive, despite many SharePoint sites and permissions previously managed through SharedWithMe.

This has high operational impact: hundreds of jobs currently save to SharePoint destinations initially set up through SharedWithMe. Currently, SAP provides no workaround or supported method to maintain these workflows once SharedWithMe is fully disabled.

Current Observations:

  • When attempting to use SharedWithMe as a source, only the most recently updated file appears. Older files or full lists shared with the user are not displayed.

  • When attempting to use SharedWithMe as a destination, no files or folders are visible to select, even though the user has access via the Microsoft OneDrive web interface.

  • Relying on individual OneDrive accounts for destinations is not feasible for succession planning or collaborative file management, as each file/folder requires individual permission management instead of group site permissions.

Steps to Reproduce: (assuming OneDrive integration works and OAuth token is generated)

  1. Create a new Webi Report

  2. Select Cloud Storage → Microsoft OneDrive → OK

  3. Shared with me (source): Only the last modified file appears, or no file appears at all.

  4. Shared with me (destination):

    • Create a new schedule for a report

    • Add Microsoft OneDrive as destination

    • Select Browse → Shared with me

    • Observe: no files/folders are present, despite the user having multiple visible files online in Microsoft OneDrive

Impact:

  • Users cannot create new jobs pointing to SharePoint sites as destinations.

  • Existing jobs may fail in the future, with no supported method to remap them.

  • Manual workarounds (e.g., saving to individual OneDrive accounts) are not sustainable for business processes.

Current SAP Actions / Requests:

  • We have opened SAP Influence Idea: Integration of Microsoft Drive as a replacement for SharedWithMe

  • This pseudo-replacement requires SAP updates and delegated permissions (using site.* vs files.* currently used for OneDrive).

Question / Call to Community:

Has anyone found a workaround or method to:

  1. Save to SharePoint sites as destinations?

  2. Use SharePoint sites as sources for Webi reports?

We are particularly interested in solutions that:

  • Do not rely on individual user OneDrive accounts

  • Preserve group site permissions

  • Are maintainable for hundreds of existing schedules/publications

entry.title: Re: Freight condition based on PO quantity STO (conversion)
entry.content:
Hi,

the system behaviour is as designed and can't be changed.

Although the condition says "absolute", there are no absolute freigt costs in SAP.

The reason is, that the delivery could be made in two partial deliveries. For this, SAP considers absolute freight costs alwas as quantity dependent and adjusts them according to the delivered quantity.

entry.content:
需要修正错误之后，再重新运行折旧。

出现错误可能原因如下：

  1. 固定资产主数据变更（使用年限、折旧码等）
  2. 折旧码定义修改或系统更新
  3. 会计年度设置或期间状态异常
  4. 历史数据传输后未重新计算折旧

执行重新计算折旧作业

重新运行折旧，使用"计划资产会计作业"(F1914)应用 选择作业模板"重新计算折旧" 设置立即开始或定义特定时间点

entry.title: Re: Lizenz für BusinessObject 4.3
entry.content:
Regarding to your issue, please kindly refer to KBA 2531837 - Best Practices of editing SAP Business Suite systems and license keys - SAP for Me

What types of changes should not (or cannot) be made to an existing systems or license keys?
If you need to change any of the following, you must create a new system with new license keys in the License Keys application. So in cases where you have a new deployment of the software, you should create a new system instead of editing an existing system. Please do not edit an existing system or license key for the following types of changes:

  • Product Name and/or Version changed  
  • Operating System changed
  • System Type or Development Phase changed (e.g. License Type changes from Test, Development, Production)
  • Database changed - Note: As mentioned above, only change the database for an existing system if all license keys under that system are to be changed to the new database. If you plan to use the old database for some systems and new data for others, you should create separate systems for each database. 
  • 3-character System ID cannot be changed (a new system needs to be created)

--->Thus please create a new system with the product version BOBJ 4.3 and use this system to apply the new key for BOBJ 4.3 then install this new key in your BOT system.

 

When creating a new system and new license keys....

  • The new system will have a new system number (this allows you to track the new system with a unique system number) but the system name can be also BOT
  • The new license keys will contain the new system details (including system number)
  • New "production" systems should be given a unique System ID according to KBA 2596229

entry.title: Re: Single BP with Customer and Vendor roles and differen...
entry.content:
Hello @AAITIPAM ,

The answer is yes, this is completely possible and is a standard way to handle combined customer and supplier roles.

Here's how you manage the separation of the two bank accounts:

Bank Account A123: Customer Direct Debit
-Since this account is for Direct Debits (you pulling money from the customer), the payment process relies on an official agreement called a Direct Debit Mandate (like a SEPA Mandate).

-You enter Bank Account A123 on the BP master record.

-You create a Direct Debit Mandate and specifically link it to Bank Account A123.

-When you run your payment process to collect money, the system uses the details found in the active Mandate, ensuring only Bank Account A123 is used.

Bank Account B456: Supplier Direct Credit
-Since this account is for Direct Credits (you sending money to the supplier), you use a setting called the Partner Bank Type to point the payment to the correct account.

-You enter Bank Account B456 on the BP master record and assign it a unique identifier, like "B456," in the Partner Bank Type field.

-When you post the supplier's invoice, you must enter this unique identifier (B456) into the payment information on that specific invoice.

-When you run the automatic payment program, it sees the "B456" Partner Bank Type on the invoice and knows to use Bank Account B456 from the BP master data for the payment.

The Key Difference: The Customer side (A123) is controlled by the Mandate, while the Supplier side (B456) is controlled by the Partner Bank Type on the invoice. This allows both accounts to exist on the same BP, each reserved for its specific function.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: F110 : payment not possible because of reported error
entry.content:
Hello @oumouKD ,

Pl. try below options and let me know.

 

AreaDetails / ExplanationWhat to Check / Fix
Error ShownPayment run stops with generic message: “Payment not possible because of reported error.” In detailed logs: FZ 642 – Bank details of the partner with bank LU account XXXXXXXX are being used.Indicates the system found bank details that do not meet payment program requirements.
Meaning of FZ 642The bank account or bank country code ("LU" in your case) is being used but does not meet the payment method requirements, or required fields for that bank are incomplete.Fix vendor/customer bank master or payment method bank rules.
Common Causes1. Missing IBAN for LU bank2. Bank key not defined in system3. Payment method does not allow bank country LU4. Payment method does not allow foreign payments5. House bank not configured for LU destinations6. Incorrect account type (Bank account vs. IBAN mismatch)7. Paying company code not assigned fullyValidate master data + FBZP config.
Vendor/Customer Master ChecksBank account assigned under BP master may be incomplete: IBAN missing, incorrect bank key, wrong bank country.BP → Payment Transactions → Bank Details. Ensure valid LU bank key + IBAN.
FBZP – Payment Method (per Company code)Payment method may not allow payments to LU bank accounts.FBZP → Payment Methods in Company Code → Check “Country of Bank” allowed.
FBZP – Payment Method (in Country)Rules for foreign banks may be restricted (e.g., requiring IBAN/BIC).Ensure LU is not blocked. Check validations for IBAN, Bank Account No., BIC.
FBZP – Bank DeterminationHouse bank may not support payments to LU (missing bank chain/bank key relationship).Assign valid ranking order + bank account with correct currency/country.
House Bank SetupNew company code house banks might be incomplete (missing bank key for LU routing).Maintain house bank → Bank key → SWIFT → IBAN structure.
Vendor Payment DataVendor's payment method may not match the company code payment method.BP → Supplier → Payment Transactions → Ensure “payment method” matches F110 run.
Currency IssuesHouse bank does not support payment currency.Ensure bank account currency matches F110 proposal requirements.
Testing Result ObservationIntentional blocking errors appear normally → means logging works → issue occurs before payment proposal is evaluated.Confirms error is caused by bank master / payment method validations.
Recommended Fix Steps1. Maintain IBAN for LU bank account2. Validate LU bank key exists in BNKA3. Ensure payment method allows LU4. Validate payment method assigned in BP5. Maintain bank determination for LU banks6. Re-run proposal after fixesAfter corrections, delete proposal & restart F110.
Additional Tools to Debug- FPAYH / FPAYP (check proposal items)- BNKA (check bank key)- FIBPU (payment method usage)- F110 simulation with log level “Extended”Helps identify missing bank fields.
ConclusionPayment fails due to incomplete/incorrect LU bank data or payment method restrictions for bank country LU in FBZP. Once fully maintained, F110 will process normally.Fix master data + payment config + rerun.

entry.title: Re: KONV-KKURS exchange rate overwrite.
entry.content:
Hello @Yesh ,

Try below options:-

 

AspectDetails / ExplanationImpact / Risk / Recommendation
FieldKONV-KKURS – Exchange rate used for converting SD condition amounts into document currencyOverwriting can corrupt audit trails, condition values, and SD/FI consistency.
SD Pricing / ReportingUsed internally by SAP pricing engine to calculate condition values (KONV-KBETR) in document currencyNon-standard rates may lead to inconsistent condition values, errors in profitability reports, and SD reporting inaccuracies (e.g., V/LA, V/I5).
FI PostingsFI document header (BKPF-KURSF) and line items rely on consistent currency conversionMismatch between SD condition values and FI postings, breaking SD-FI reconciliation.
Revenue Accounting and Reporting (RAR)RAR calculates Performance Obligation (POB) currency, Standalone Selling Price (SSP), and revenue allocations based on SD condition dataManual changes to KONV-KKURS can lead to: • Incorrect SSP calculations • Wrong revenue allocations • Inaccurate IFRS 15/ASC 606 disclosures
Data IntegrityOverwriting standard technical fields risks violating system consistencyAvoid direct modifications; maintain integrity for SD → FI → RAR flows.
SAP Standard ComplianceOverwriting KONV-KKURS is non-standard SAP behaviorCan conflict with future updates; reduces system maintainability and audit compliance.
Recommended Alternative 1Use a custom exchange rate type (OB08) and assign it to the condition typeMaintains standard behavior; ensures correct rate determination by SAP pricing engine.
Recommended Alternative 2Use Condition Base Value Formula (VOFM routine) to modify base amounts instead of changing the rateAvoids direct manipulation of KONV-KKURS; preserves SD/FI/RAR integrity.
Consultation / GovernanceAny modification affecting currency conversion should involve FI/CO and RAR teamsEnsures compliance with accounting standards (IFRS 15 / ASC 606) and avoids reporting errors.
ConclusionOverwriting KONV-KKURS directly is high-riskUse SAP-standard approaches (custom rate type or VOFM routines) to achieve the desired results safely.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh
